Articles.Content:
Don't know about you guys, but after my most recent break of a year or so, I'm really missing some of the great mods from back in the "day".   Kinda miss Bobcats stuff, although I don't miss his time schedule or lack of consistency.  With so many great models, packs, code and awesome plugins, I'm curious if a small group of senior "type" moders, wouldn't be interested in going back and digging up some of the lost.  Like I said, so many great models with Hundreds and Hundreds of hours of build and creation time, it just seems like a waist to let them all just rot away.  Delta_8930 is going to patch up the Horizon Aeronautics Zenit, and Alexustas is getting back at the greatest IVA systems Kerbal's have ever seen.  Back right before Dragon01 got his ass booted, he and Paul were going to re-release a bunch of new Bobcat stuff, don't know if any of it ever came to fruition, but maybe some one can have more luck at getting Paul to respond to his YouTube channel, with a request to release some of his content out of private to public. Would like to see Quantum Struts up again, even though they are a complete Fantasy item, they are an incredible help if used "responsibly".....  lol 

I know most of you guys are busy, and most of us understand this and don't ask for updates out or respect, but letting complete finished, "Great" mods go to waist seems kinda sinful.  Trust me,  if I knew what I was doing, I wouldn't be making this thread.  I even stopped by my local community College to see if they had classes that would help me learn just that, to create and or update mods for KSP.  I'm not young by any stretch, but I know I could learn a great deal of this stuff, in a couple terms, but I live in an honest to God..... "One horse town"  No courses for Dren.


Most of this stuff was done very well.  Most of us miss their Rovers, at least I know I do.  

 

Well anywho, just thought I would throw that out to see if anyone agreed with me.  BTW: I don't know [redacted] when it comes to Modeling, code or anything else important or of use, but if any modders need help doing the monotonous work, would be glad to help in any way that I can. Thx all for making my KSP a never ending open world game.

Up in Oregon, Dren

Edited November 22, 2016 by monstah
Removed profanity
Hmmm... Its a good idea. Though it would take a long time to revive them all, And some would be unrecoverable because of the ban on mediafire links, Which used to be popular on the forum.

" All original BobCat ind. content - all rights reserved and belong to BobCat. "

End of story.

32 minutes ago, sarbian said:

" All original BobCat ind. content - all rights reserved and belong to BobCat. "

End of story.

Yep, i don't know if you read the post Sarbian, but I said,  "maybe someone would have better luck contacting Paul than I have".  But yes, like I said, maybe he would consider releasing the private hold for some public.  Maybe you just skimmed it.

It sure would be great to get him to respond to a PM about this possibility.  BTW: Good to see your still hanging around Sarbian, I'm sure some of your content has become mandatory for many users.

14 minutes ago, ArkaelDren said:

Maybe you just skimmed it.

Indeed I did but it is not the first time someone tries to do it. It s shame to see such greats models not be used but since them we also had amazing new mods that replace some of them nicely.

And thanks, I try to stay around. The modding community of KSP is far too great to leave and the current Unity version open some nice possibilities (too bad it does not add a few hours to each days)
